metadata.title: CVE-2017-9358 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A memory exhaustion vulnerability exists in Asterisk Open Source 13.xbefore 13.15.1 and 14.x before 14.4.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before13.13-cert4, which can be triggered by sending specially crafted SCCPpackets causing an infinite loop and leading to memory exhaustion (bymessage logging in that loop).

criterions.comment: asterisk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
